snippet: Contrary to popular perception, the U.S. is on a better path than Europe: transitioning from coal to gas, investing its new technologies, and reducing its emissions at a faster rate than Europe is.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Dieter Helm holds United States is on better path than Europe toward reducing carbon emissions and switching to renewable energy, despite lamentations of many environmentalists; calls for carbon tax in order to curb global carbon emissions.
lead_paragraph: Contrary to popular perception, the U.S. is on a better path than Europe: transitioning from coal to gas, investing its new technologies, and reducing its emissions at a faster rate than Europe is.

headline.seo: On Climate Change, the U.S. Is Doing Better Than Europe
